glsa.title: qmailAdmin: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: qmailAdmin is vulnerable to a buffer overflow that could lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: qmailAdmin is a free software package that provides a web interface for managing a qmail system with virtual domains.

description.p: qmailAdmin fails to properly handle the "PATH_INFO" variable in qmailadmin.c. The PATH_INFO is a standard CGI environment variable filled with user supplied data.

impact.p: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending qmailAdmin a maliciously crafted URL that could lead to the execution of arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running qmailAdmin.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
